page.title: 12Telscombe Manor
page.content: Telscombe Manor a beautiful old stone and flint building close to the main lane started out as a farm cottage, but over the centuries it has been added to until it reached its present size. A tower was added in the middle of the twentieth century keeping the flint faced style. A large number of the fitments came from an old house in the west country (when it was demolished). These have been well introduced to the style of the house. Many of the doors are disguised as highly polished fitted items of furniture, one magnificent 'glass cabinet' actually being the door to the now disused smugglers tunnel (which once led to the church). The grounds are ornate and include a seventeenth century sun-dial.
